body_html: This sounds like a reasonable thing to add as a custom transformation in tf.contrib.data. If each of the time series are small and can fit in memory, you can generate the windows using Dataset.flat_map() as I suggested here. However, it might make sense to support a similar transformation of unbounded-length streams.
body_text: This sounds like a reasonable thing to add as a custom transformation in tf.contrib.data. If each of the time series are small and can fit in memory, you can generate the windows using Dataset.flat_map() as I suggested here. However, it might make sense to support a similar transformation of unbounded-length streams.
body: This sounds like a reasonable thing to add as a custom transformation in `tf.contrib.data`. If each of the time series are small and can fit in memory, you can generate the windows using `Dataset.flat_map()` as I suggested [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/14906#issuecomment-347396872). However, it might make sense to support a similar transformation of unbounded-length streams.
